New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 71st international century after 1,020 days and 83 international innings.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar returned figures of 4-1-4-5, a notable bowling performance.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 122 off 61 balls.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar took 5 wickets for 4 runs.
Kohli hit a six off Rashid Khan, which is a rare feat.
Kohli's hundred came with a flat six via a pull to a short-of-a-length delivery.
Bhuvneshwar's fourth ball was a perfect delivery, dismissing Hazratullah Zazai.
Bhuvneshwar's outswinger-inswinger trick dismissed Karim Janat and Najibullah Zadran.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed surprise at scoring a century in this format.
Kohli acknowledged the support and love of his wife Anushka during his century drought.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan played less than 24 hours after their match against Pakistan.
Afghanistan dropped three relatively easy catches.
The match started with the energy of a dead rubber.
India made three changes to their lineup.
